Dare: Do your best Buzz Lightyear impression.
Truth: When was the last time you cleaned your room?

Dare: Do your best Mickey Mouse impression.
Truth: Is there a mess under your bed?

Dare: Do your best lion roar.
Truth: Is there a mess in your closet?

Dare: Do your best Batman impression.
Truth: Have you ever snuck a snack?

Dare: Do your best Disney princess impression.
Truth: Have you ever said you finished your dinner when you really didn’t?

Dare: Prank call Grandma.
Truth: Have you ever cheated on a test?

Dare: Attempt to slip on a banana peel (or pretend to).
Truth: Have you ever faked a sickness to stay home from school?

Dare: Make a really silly face and take a selfie.
Truth: Have you ever used your lunch money for something other than lunch?

Dare: Act like a cat.
Truth: Have you ever watched a movie or TV show that you know you’re not allowed to?

Dare: Act like a monkey.
Truth: What are some ways you cheat on chores?

Dare: Sing the ABCs backward.
Truth: Have you ever skipped school?

Dare: Go ask the neighbor for a cup of sugar.
Truth: Have you ever lied about your age?

Dare: Go outside and yell, "Happy New Year!
Truth: Which would you rather have for dinner: fast food or your family's home cooking?

Dare: Do the chicken dance.
Truth: Have you ever cried during a movie? If so, which one?

Dare: Do the Macarena silently until it is your turn again.
Truth: Have you ever broken something and blamed someone else?

Dare: Do the disco.
Truth: What is your favorite meal your family makes?

Dare: Use the driveway as a catwalk for five minutes, while giving the model wave to any passing cars or people.
Truth: Have you ever peeked at your presents early?

Dare: Wear underwear on your head for the rest of the game.
Truth: Have you had your first kiss?

Dare: Try to dress the family pet.
Truth: Do you have a crush on anyone?

Dare: Do the Hokey Pokey without singing it.
Truth: Are you afraid of the dark?

Dare: Go outside and yell, “I pick my nose!” to the first person you see.
Truth: Do you have any secrets?

Dare: Finish every sentence with the words “while I dance” or “with a cherry on top.” (Or whatever silly thing you can think of!)
Truth: Do you keep a diary/journal?

Dare: Start every sentence with "What is . . . " like you're on Jeopardy.
Truth: Do you still enjoy TV shows for little kids, like Blues Clues?

Dare: Talk in the third person.
Truth: Do you sleep with a blankie?

Dare: Talk in a high-pitched voice.
Truth: What does your (mom/dad/sister/brother/etc.) do that embarrasses you?

Dare: Be a commentator for the remainder of the game.
Truth: Do you bite your nails?

Dare: Pretend to be a T-Rex.
Truth: Do you pick your nose?

Dare: Talk and act like a robot.
Truth: Have you ever peed in a pool?

Dare: Snort excessively when laughing.
Truth: What is the grossest thing you've done today?

Dare: Pretend to have chicken pox by sticking round labels all over yourself.
Truth: When was the last time you flossed your teeth?

Dare: Talk and act like a cowboy or cowgirl.
Truth: Have you ever drooled in your sleep?

Dare: Go outside and howl at the moon (if it’s dark outside).
Truth: Have you ever eaten a bug?

Dare: Do jumping jacks until your next turn.
Truth: Do you pick scabs?

Dare: Do the cha-cha until your next turn.
Truth: Have you ever passed gas loudly in class?

Dare: Hug your mailbox (or a tree or lawn ornament) for 20 seconds.
Truth: Have you ever passed gas and blamed someone else?

Dare: Act like a chicken.
Truth: What would you do with $1,000?

Dare: Attempt to do 10 pushups (or fewer for littler kids).
Truth: If you could be any celebrity, who would you be and why?

Dare: Crabwalk across the room.
Truth: Is there anything that you would change about yourself?

Dare: Army crawl across the room.
Truth: Is there anything that you would change about your school?

Dare: Attempt a cartwheel.
Truth: What is your biggest fear?

Dare: Run around the outside of the house three times. (Change this as needed to fit your living space—run up and down the hall, around the room, to another room and back, etc.)
Truth: What is your worst habit?

Dare: Chug a cup of (water, milk, juice, etc.).
Truth: What is the least favorite gift you’ve ever received?

Dare: Touch your nose with your tongue.
Truth: Have you ever lied to me?

Dare: Stick a spoon on your nose and keep it there as long a possible.
Truth: What is something you wish you were better at?

Dare: Spin in circles for 10 seconds.
Truth: When was the last time you did something nice for someone else?

Dare: Sniff (person of choice)’s shoe.
Wear your shoes on your hands for the next five minutes.
Belt out a song of your choice.
Have a full conversation with a broom (or a chair or a wall—whatever's handy!).
Use a hairbrush as a microphone (or a shoe or a spoon—again, whatever's handy!).
Sing what you have to say instead of talking.
Keep your finger on the tip of your nose as if it’s stuck there.
Remove one sock and shoe so that one foot is bare for the rest of the game.
Talk with your tongue sticking out.
Switch clothes with someone.
Draw a picture of (something the group picks) while blindfolded.
Let someone fix your hair the way they want and leave it that way.
Try to catch three pieces of small food tossed by someone in your mouth (popcorn, grapes, etc.).
Take a bite of a sandwich made by everyone that contains whatever they desire, and try to guess each ingredient on the sandwich.
Let someone tickle you for 30 seconds.
Get wrapped from head to toe in toilet paper.
Smell everyone’s breath and guess what they ate last.
Close your eyes and shake hands with all the other players. Guess whose handshake is whose.
Make up nicknames for all the other players.
Give one of the other players a high five every time someone says the word "dare" for the rest of the game.
Introduce yourself to all the other players like you've never met them before.
Pretend to win an award and give a speech thanking all of the other players for their help.
Play pat-a-cake with two other players simultaneously.
Crack an egg over your head.
Eat a plate of (dinner, dessert, whatever) with no hands.
Eat a spoonful of sugar.
Eat a spoonful of hot sauce.
Eat a hot pepper.
Take a bite out of a stick of butter.
Dump a cup of ice water over your head.
Juggle eggs (outside).
Hold an ice cube in your hand until it melts.
Eat a clove or a spoonful of minced garlic.
Stuff as many marshmallows (or grapes, donut holes, etc.) into your mouth as you can!
Stack five cookies on your forehead. (Oreos work great!)
Jump into the pool or submerge yourself in the bathtub fully clothed.
Jump while holding a cup full of water above your head without spilling it.
Bob for an apple. (A large mixing bowl full of water works well!)
Make a face mask out of sliced cheese.
Eat a huge spoonful of peanut butter and sing the ABCs.
Put ice cubes down your shirt (with your shirt tucked in).
Stand on your hands.
Fetch (item of choice in another room) with a blindfold on.
Make up a poem aloud.
Take off your socks with a pair of tongs.
Text someone using only your nose.
Pop a balloon without using your hands or your teeth.
Suck an ice cube until it melts—no chewing allowed! (Or suck a couple of ice cubes at the same time, if they are small.)
Sniff the pepper shaker.
Do your makeup in 10 seconds (eye shadow, blush, and lipstick).
Spin 10 times and try to do hopscotch.
Spin 10 times and try to skip rope.
Draw a mustache on yourself without a mirror.
Stop blinking for 30 seconds.
Talk without moving your lips.
Skip everywhere you go instead of walking or running.
Walk backwards wherever you go.
Put all your clothes on inside out.
Put all your clothes on backwards.
Take your age, reverse the numbers, and act that age. (If player is only a single digit, just add a 0 to their age. Example: The player is 8, so they must act 80.)
Talk while holding your tongue with your index finger and thumb.
Put your leg behind your head.
Draw a stickman on paper by holding the writing utensil in your mouth.
Tie your shoes together and try not to forget!
Take a wet willy.
Play fetch like a dog, running on all fours and using only your mouth to fetch.
